intro: Alchemilla eversiana, commonly known as silverweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its rosette of silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Alchemilla eversiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
